results.justification: The document states it uses 'Quantitative ethnography' and details the integration of qualitative and quantitative methods.
Sections 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 3.1, 3.2, and 3.3 provide a detailed description of the course design, research questions, participants, data sources, data transformation, and network analysis.
The document does not state that the raw or processed datasets are publicly available.
While privacy isn't explicitly mentioned, the document doesn't offer data access, and no justification is provided.
Section 3.1 details the coding process and the creation of a consolidated list of textual expressions matched to the keywords, functioning as a codebook.
The document describes data collection as students’ inputs in online discussion forums and records of their assignment performance (Section 2.3).
The document mentions using web-ENA1 but does not provide a link to the code repository.
No justification is provided for why the code is not shared.
Section 3.1 describes the creation of Excel formulas for counting code occurrences, indicating code for data preparation was used.
The document describes the use of t-tests, singular value decomposition (SVD), and network analysis.
The document reports t-test results, p-values, and Cohen’s d (effect sizes) (e.g., Table 2).
The document includes subjective interpretation of the network analysis results and discusses conceptual engagement patterns.
The document describes the manual coding process and the iterative refinement of the codebook (Section 3.1).
The results of the ENA and ONA analyses are presented with figures and tables, and are clearly described in the text.
The document discusses limitations related to the sample size and the potential influence of factors beyond epistemic orientation (Section 4).
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration.
